desc: Fever is also known as Hyperthermia,Pyrexia or elevated temperature. It describes a body temperature that is higher than normal. Fever can affect children and adults.
cure: Make sure that the room temperature is comfortable. Take regular bath. Have acetominophen(Tylenol) or Ibuprofen(Advil). Drink plenty of fluids.

desc: Influenza or Flu is a respiratory illness that results from a viral infection. Flu is highly contagious and it spreads through respiratory droplets. A person can pass it on while talking or through physical contact.
cure: Stay at home. Keep warm and rest. Consume plenty of liquids and healthy foods. Avoid alcohol and smoking. Have Herbal teas.

desc: Asthma is a condition in which your airways narrow and swell and produce extra mucus. This can make breathing difficult and trigger coughing, wheezing and shortness of breath. For some people, asthma is a minor nuisance. a negative response to emotional stress can cause an asthma attack.
cure: Accupuncture. Taking Herbs and natural supplements: magnesium, omega-3 fatty acids, and antioxidant supplements such as vitamin D and vitamins A, C, and E. Breathing exercises in yoga

desc: Pneumonia is an infection that inflames the air sacs in one or both lungs. The air sacs may fill with fluid or pus (purulent material), causing cough with phlegm or pus, fever, chills, and difficulty breathing. A variety of organisms, including bacteria, viruses and fungi, can cause pneumonia.
cure: Control your fever with aspirin, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs, such as ibuprofen or naproxen), or acetaminophen.Drink plenty of fluids,warm beverages. take steamy baths. Use a humidifier to ease breathing.Quit Smoking. Get lots of rest. Eating a varied diet rich in whole-food choices may help the body heal, and adequate liquid intake is essential. Water, herbal teas, soups, and broths are all easy ways to increase the liquid intake while recovering from pneumonia. Consume peppermint, Eucalyptus and fenugreek tea. Do saltwater gargle. Drink a small amount of caffeine.

desc: Dehydration is a condition that can occur when the loss of body fluids, mostly water, exceeds the amount that is taken in. With dehydration, more water is moving out of individual cells and then out of the body than the amount of water that is taken in through drinking.
cure: Acoid drinks containing caffeine such as coffee,tea or soda's.Water,electrolyte infused water, pedialyte,gatorade, wattermelon, coconut water.

desc: Food poisoning is an illness caused by eating contaminated food. It's not usually serious and most people get better within a few days without treatment. In most cases of food poisoning, the food is contaminated by bacteria, such as salmonella or Escherichia coli (E. coli), or a virus, such as the norovirus
cure: Consume blander foods like cereal,rice,toast and bananas. Avoid fatty, sugary,spicy foods,caffeine,dairy products and alcohol. Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS) are recomended.

desc: Sore Throatis a pain or irritation in the throat that can occur with or without swallowing, often accompanies infections, such as a cold or flu .
cure: Take rest. Consume comforting foods and beverages like tea, herbal tea or coffee. cold treats such as ice pops can soothen throat. drink plenty of fluids. Gargle with saltwater. Use Humidifier. Avoid irritants such as cigarette smoke stay away from them.

desc: A sore that develops on the lining of the oesophagus, stomach or small intestine.
cure: Choose a healthy diet full of fruits, especially with vitamins A and C, vegetables, and whole grains. Not eating vitamin-rich foods may make it difficult for your body to heal your ulcer. Consume foods containing probiotics. Elimintae milk. Control stress. Dont smoke. Limit or avoid alcohol.

desc: A brain tumor is a mass or growth of abnormal cells in your brain.Some brain tumors are noncancerous (benign), and some brain tumors are cancerous (malignant).
cure: Surgerry such as Radiation therapy, chemotherapy, targetted drug therapy and radiosurgery. Some complementary curing includes arttherapy, music, accunpuncture, meditation and relaxing exercise.Breathe in Frankincense Essential Oil, Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy, Consume Cancer Fighting Phytonutrients,Ketogenic Diet,Calorie Restriction,Be Wary of Mobile Devices.

desc: A blockage of blood flow to the heart muscle.
cure: Be active,Quit smoking,Maintain a healthy diet. Have a check on cholestrol levels.Stress at bay,Diabetes check. Take Omega-3-fatty acids, pomegranate juice, capsaicin, ginger, garlic, holy basil, curcumin, alfalfa, green tea. Avoid alcohol. Do regular health check-ups. In case of heart pain Chew and swallow an aspirin.

desc: A mosquito-borne viral disease occurring in tropical and subtropical areas.
cure:
Drinking  sufficient water,juice of pappaya leaves,chew basil leaves,neem leaves. Consume orange juice
. keep a constant check on your platelet level.

desc: An increased build-up of fat in the liver.Fatty tissue slowly builds up in the liver when a person's diet exceeds the amount of fat his or her body can handle. A person has a fatty liver when fatmakes up at least 5% of the liver 1.
cure: Alcohol avoidance, Physical exercise, Weight loss and Diabetes management. Eat a nutrient-rich diet that’s low in excess calories, saturated fat, and trans fats. Eat a diet that’s rich in plant-based foods, including fruits, vegetables, legumes, and whole grains. Limit your consumption of refined carbohydrates, such as sweets, white rice, white bread, other refined grain products. Limit your consumption of saturated fats, which are found in red meat and many other animal products. Avoid trans fats, which are present in many processed snack foods

desc: A yellow tint to the skin or eyes caused by an excess of bilirubin, a substance created when red blood cells break down.
cure:
Take iron supplements or eat more iron-rich foods. Hepatitis-induced jaundice requires antiviral or steroid medications. Doctors can treat obstruction-induced jaundice by surgically removing the obstruction. If the jaundice has been caused by use of a medication, treatment for involves changing to an alternative medication. Try to eat one or more servings of high-fiber food at each meal. Men should strive to eat 38 grams
Trusted Source
of fiber daily, and women should eat at least 25 GRAMS.

desc: A viral fever is any fever that's caused by an underlying viralillness. A variety of viral infections can affect humans, from the common cold to the flu.
cure: Drink fluids. Get plenty of rest. Stay cool. Avoid too many blankets.

desc: Typhoid fever is an infection that spreads through contaminated food and water.
cure: The only effective treatment for typhoid is antibiotics. Drink fluids. Take ORS(Oral Rehydration Salts). Use cold compress.Consume aplle cider vinegar, basil, Garlic, Bananas, Cloves, Pomogranate,Triphula Churan.

desc: A disease caused by a plasmodium parasite, transmitted by the bite of infected mosquitoes.
cure: Cinamon, turmeric, orange juice, apple cider vinegar, sweet lime juice, mustard oil, grape fruit, fenugreek seeds. Tretaed in a hospital with prescribed medicines by a doctor.

desc: A condition in which the blood doesn't have enough healthy red blood cells.
cure: Increase vitamin c intake. Yogurt with turmeric. Eat more green vegetables, fresh betroot or pomogranate juice, copper water, seasame seeds, Raisins and dates. Get a blood transfusion done.

desc: Diabetes is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high.
cure: A combination of medications, exercises and diets can help keep diabetes at bay. Insulin prescibed by a doctor. Exercise regularly. Increase your fiber intake. control your carb intake. implement portion control diet. Stay hydrated. Choose foods with a low Glycemic index. Control stress levels. Eat foods rich in chromium and magnesium. Get enough sleep.

desc: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.
cure: Treated by Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, Anti-inflammatory, Steroid, Immunosuppressive drug, Vitamin and Antibiotics. Consume food which includes probiotics, prebiotics and anti-inflammatory foods.

desc: A potentially serious infectious bacterial disease that mainly affects the lungs.they can also damage other parts of the body. TB spreads through the air when a person with TB of the lungs or throat coughs, sneezes, or talks.
cure: Will require a long course of treatment involving multiple antibiotics. Leafy, dark-colored greens like kale and spinach, for their high iron and B-vitamin content.Plenty of whole grains, like whole wheat pastas, breads, and cereals. Antioxidant-rich, brightly-colored vegetables, such as carrots, peppers, and squash, and fruits, like tomatoes, blueberries, and cherries — think of buying produce in a full rainbow of colors,Unsaturated fats like vegetable or olive oil, instead of butter.Skip tobacco in all forms.Don't drink alcohol — it can add to the risk of liver damage from some of the drugs used to treat your TB.Limit coffee and other caffeinated drinks. Limit refined products, like sugar, white breads, and white rice. Avoid high-fat, high-cholesterol red meat and instead load up on leaner protein sources like poultry, beans, tofu, and fish.

desc: A rare but serious bacterial infection that's transmitted by fleas.
cure: Bubonic plague requires urgent hospital treatment with strong antibiotics.

desc: Inflammation of brain and spinal cord membranes, typically caused by an infection.
cure:
Antibiotics, Steroid and Penicillin antibiotic.Bacterial meningitis requires immediate hospitalization.Fungal meningitis is treated with antifungal agents.
Parasitic meningitis may either involve treating just the symptoms or attempting to treat the infection directly.Viral meningitis may resolve on its own, but some causes of viral meningitis will be treated with intravenous antiviral medications.

desc: Pneumonic plague is a severe lung infection caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis.Antibiotics must be given within 24 hours of first symptoms to reduce the risk of death.
cure: Requires Antibiotics.

desc: A serious infection of the nose and throat that's easily preventable by a vaccine
cure: Treatments include antibiotics and an antitoxin that neutralises the diphtheria toxin. A vaccine is available. Recovering from diphtheria requires lots of bed rest. Avoiding any physical exertion is particularly important if your heart has been affected. You may need to get your nutrition through liquids and soft foods for a while because of pain and difficulty swallowing. Strict isolation while you're contagious helps prevent the spread of the infection. Careful hand-washing by everyone in your house is important for limiting the spread of the infection. Once you recover from diphtheria, you'll need a full course of diphtheria vaccine to prevent a recurrence. Unlike some other infections, having diphtheria doesn't guarantee lifetime immunity. You can get diphtheria more than once if you're not fully immunized against it.
